The species jump: the species jump that initiates a first human infection by a new agent is often brought about by a novel or unusual physical contact between potential pathogen and human. Such contacts usually occur because of cultural, social, behavioural or technological change on the part of humans that affects the human–animal interface. The potential for subsequent spread of this ‘new’ infectious disease will depend on many different factors, including environmental or social factors.
